# The `TimeRegion` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timeregion">TimeRegion</a> class is used as a helper class to call the startTimer() and stopTimer() methods of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer">Timer</a> class. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timeregion">TimeRegion</a> class is used as a helper class to call the startTimer() and stopTimer() methods of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer">Timer</a> class.

When the object is constructed, it starts the timer specified as its argument. When it is destroyed, it stops the relevant timer. This makes it easy to time a region of code.

Definition at line 148 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/timer-h">Timer.h</a>.
